titleStmt.title: Recto, first text, Contract with subscription|Recto, second text, Document (?) or Literary work (?)|Verso, Document, Roman CE iii [HIB]

msContents.summary: The verso text may have been written much later than the recto texts.

msItemStruct.note: This papyrus previously had three inventory numbers (P.CtYBR inv. 160A (first text), 160A (second text), and 160B), which have been consolidated into one.

Margins: Recto: first text, bottom, right?
second text, left, bottom
Verso, Right, bottom?

This papyrus contains three separate texts. The recto contains two texts, while the verso has one text. The first recto text is 13 lines and the second recto text is 1 line. The second recto text was written upside down with respect to the first text.

layoutDesc.ab:
Recto: first text, 13
second text, 1
Verso, 1

acquisition.p:
Acquisition Information, 1927: Purchased in Egypt on behalf of Yale, with funds that may have been donated by the General Education Fund of the Rockefeller Foundation's General Education Board. The dealers' names are given as Harold Idris Bell reported them in his 1927 report.
P.CtYBR inv. 160 and 161 were purchased by William Linn Westermann from M. Elgabry in Cairo, 11 January 1927.
The manuscripts were brought to Yale from the British Museum between 9 May and 11 October 1927.

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
